objects.thumbCaption:
Гипокрейные - Hypocreaceae

The Hypocreaceae are a family within the class Sordariomycetes. Species of Hypocreaceae are usually recognized by their brightly colored, perithecial ascomata,…
objects.name: Гипокрейные - Hypocreaceae
objects.comment: The Hypocreaceae are a family within the class Sordariomycetes. Species of Hypocreaceae are usually recognized by their brightly colored, perithecial ascomata, typically yellow, orange or red. The family was proposed by Giuseppe De Notaris in 1844. According to the Dictionary of the Fungi (10th edition, 2008), the family has 22 genera and 454 species.
objects.title: Гипокрейные - Hypocreaceae

objects.thumbCaption:
Кордицепсовые - Cordycipitaceae

objects.name: Кордицепсовые - Cordycipitaceae
objects.comment: The Cordycipitaceae are a family of parasitic fungi in the Ascomycota, class Sordariomycetes and order Hypocreales. The family was first published in 1969 by mycologist Hanns Kreisel, but the naming was invalid according to the code of International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi, and plants. It was validly published in 2007.
objects.title: Кордицепсовые - Cordycipitaceae

objects.thumbCaption:
Нектриевые - Nectriaceae

The Nectriaceae comprise a family of fungi in the order Hypocreales. It was circumscribed by brothers Charles and Louis René Tulasne in 1865.

objects.name: Спорыньёвые - Clavicipitaceae
objects.comment: The Clavicipitaceae are a family of fungi within the order Hypocreales. A 2008 estimate placed 43 genera in the family, but recent work has increased this number to 97.
objects.title: Спорыньёвые - Clavicipitaceae

name: Гипокрейные - Hypocreales
comment:
The Hypocreales are an order of fungi within the class Sordariomycetes. In 2008, it was estimated that it contained some 237 genera, and 2647 species in seven families. Since then, a considerable number of further taxa have been identified, including an additional family, the Stachybotryaceae. According to the Catalog of Life, As of April 2021 the Hypocreales contains 6 families, 137 genera, and 1411 species.
Species of Hypocreales are usually recognized by their brightly colored, perithecial ascomata, or spore-producing structures. These are often yellow, orange or red.
title: Гипокрейные - Hypocreales
